programme.title: Kick-Ass 2
programme.desc: Action comedy drama starring Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Chloë Grace Moretz and Jim Carrey. As a new wave of amateur masked crusaders takes to the streets, Kick-Ass and Hit Girl continue to refine their superhero skills in private. programme.title: My Best Friend's Wedding
programme.desc: Romantic comedy starring Julia Roberts, Dermot Mulroney and Cameron Diaz. When food critic Julianne Potter learns that her best friend and ex-lover, sportswriter Michael O'Neal, is getting married, she vows to sabotage the wedding. programme.title: Catch Me If You Can
programme.sub-title: Documentary And Factual, Drama, Crime/detective, Comedy ║ 2002 ║ 12
programme.desc: Comedy drama, based on the true story of conman Frank Abagnale Jr, starring Leonardo DiCaprio and Tom Hanks. Shattered by the news that his parents are divorcing, 16-year-old Frank runs away to New York. programme.title: Goodfellas
programme.desc: Martin Scorsese's crime drama, starring Robert De Niro, Ray Liotta and Joe Pesci. In 1950s New York, Irish-Italian schoolboy Henry Hill dreams of becoming a gangster and lands a job parking cars for the Mob. Having earned the respect of the local Mafia boss, he is teamed with hitmen James Conway and Tommy DeVito. programme.title: Transformers: Rise Of The Beasts
programme.sub-title: Action, Fantasy, War, Drama, Sci Fi ║ 2023 ║ 12A
programme.desc: In 1994 New York City, ex-serviceman Noah Diaz accepts a job from neighbourhood chancer Reek to steal a sports car. The high-end vehicle turns out to be robot-in-disguise Mirage, who propels Noah into the midst of a hunt for a precious Transwarp key. The device will allow Autobot leader Optimus Prime and his mechanised compatriots to return home to Cybertron. programme.desc: Former Royal Navy officer Bernie Jordan is happily settled with wife Rene at a care home. programme.title: To Catch a Killer
programme.desc: Eleanor is a talented but troubled young rookie detective wrestling with the demons of her past, when she is called to the scene of a brutal mass shooting - the work of a new and terrifying murderer. The police and FBI launch a nationwide manhunt, but are thwarted at every turn by the killer's enigmatic, and unprecedented behaviour. Despite her lack of experience, Eleanor is drawn deeper into the case as she, and her newfound mentor, realise that she may be the only person, given her own tortured psyche, who can understand the mind of this singular killer. programme.title: Rear Window
programme.desc: Classic thriller starring James Stewart and Grace Kelly. Confined to a wheelchair following an accident, magazine photographer Jeff Jeffries passes the time by observing the behaviour of his neighbours. One in particular catches his attention: Thorwald, a salesman he sees leaving the flat with a suitcase, and whose invalid wife has seemingly disappeared. programme.title: The Good Neighbour
programme.desc: A nightmarish evening unfolds for neighbours David and Robert when they accidentally hit a woman on her bike and flee the scene. programme.title: Last Seen Alive

programme.title: The Cinema List
programme.desc: Celebrate Black History Month with a look back at some of our favourite black directors, exploring their greatest contributions to cinema.

programme.title: Moving On
programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Jane Fonda and Lily Tomlin. At the funeral for an old friend, Claire approaches the deceased's widower and states that she intends to murder him in revenge for something terrible he did decades ago. Claire then reconnects with her estranged college pal, Evelyn, who agrees to help out - if only to see if Claire really follows through.. programme.title: Against All Odds (1984)
programme.desc: When a down-and-out athlete is tasked with finding a crooked nightclub owner's girlfriend, the two fall in love and must endure unexpected twists. (1984)(117 mins).

programme.desc: Art critic Keller's radical past comes back to bite when he's asked to assassinate a Chilean murderer. Cerebral thriller. (1989)(87 mins).

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: Previews of the great films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: The Country Girl
programme.desc: Drama starring Bing Crosby as a singer whose fall from grace has left him with an addiction to alcohol. An Oscar-winning Grace Kelly co-stars as his wife. (1954)(99 mins).

programme.title: Earth Girls Are Easy
programme.desc: A California girl befriends three aliens after their spaceship lands in her swimming pool. Musical comedy with Jim Carrey and Jeff Goldblum. (1988)(96 mins).

programme.title: Oh! What A Lovely War
programme.desc: Musical send-up of WWI, satirising the path towards the trenches.

programme.title: The Bridges At Toko-Ri
programme.desc: Fighter pilot William Holden struggles with perilous missions, as well as his own ambivalence towards the Korean War. Gripping drama with Grace Kelly and Mickey Rooney. (1955)(102 mins).

programme.title: Funny Face
programme.desc: Audrey Hepburn is the naive beauty plucked from obscurity by opportunistic photographer Fred Astaire to become a top fashion model. Sparkling musical romance. (1957)(99 mins).

programme.title: Alfie (1966)
programme.desc: London lothario Michael Caine charms Shelley Winters, Eleanor Bron and Jane Asher in this swinging 60s drama nominated for five Oscars. Moderate violence/sex references. (1966)(108 mins).

programme.title: Shirley Valentine
programme.desc: Liverpool housewife Pauline Collins finds love in the sun when she falls for Greek waiter Tom Conti. Crowd-pleasing romantic comedy. Strong language/sexual references. (1989)(104 mins).

programme.title: A Beautiful Mind
programme.desc: Russell Crowe stars as maths genius John Nash, who finds that paranoia and schizophrenia are problems he may never solve. Acclaimed drama. Mature themes/flashing images. (2001)(136 mins).

programme.desc: When a down-and-out athlete is tasked with finding a crooked nightclub owner's girlfriend, the two fall in love and must endure unexpected twists. (1984)(117 mins).

programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Jane Fonda and Lily Tomlin. At the funeral for an old friend, Claire approaches the deceased's widower and states that she intends to murder him in revenge for something terrible he did decades ago. Claire then reconnects with her estranged college pal, Evelyn, who agrees to help out - if only to see if Claire really follows through.. programme.title: The Cinema List
programme.desc: Celebrate Black History Month with a look back at some of our favourite black directors, exploring their greatest contributions to cinema.

programme.title: Moving On
programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Jane Fonda and Lily Tomlin. At the funeral for an old friend, Claire approaches the deceased's widower and states that she intends to murder him in revenge for something terrible he did decades ago. Claire then reconnects with her estranged college pal, Evelyn, who agrees to help out - if only to see if Claire really follows through.. programme.title: One Life

programme.desc: United Archives 31/3/96. United faced Chelsea at Villa Park for a place in the FA Cup Final.

programme.title: PL: Wimbledon v United 96/97

programme.title: PL: Liverpool v United 97/98
programme.desc: United Archives 6/12/97. Alex Ferguson's side were looking for a fourth straight win over Liverpool, a feat that hadn't been achieved since 1914 when they visited Anfield in December.

programme.title: FAC: Chelsea v United 97/98
programme.desc: United Archives 4/1/98. United travel to Stamford Bridge to take on FA Cup holders Chelsea in the tie of the 3rd Round.

programme.title: PL: United v Tottenham 01/02
programme.desc: United Archives 6/3/02. David Beckham once again produces a fine display against Spurs as the Reds ease to victory at Old Trafford.

programme.title: United v PL: Leicester City 98/99
programme.desc: United Archives. 15/8/98. The Iconic 98/99 Premier League Season begins as Leicester City visit Old Trafford.

programme.title: FAC SF: Arsenal v United 98/99
programme.desc: United Archives 11/4/99. United and Arsenal went head-to-head at Villa Park for a place in the FA Cup Final, with Reds looking to keep their treble dream alive.

programme.title: 1999 UCL Final v Bayern Munich
programme.desc: United Archives 26/5/99. An absolute classic, with two trophies in the bag only Bayern Munich stood between United and an unprecedented treble.

programme.title: PL: Bradford v United 99/00
programme.desc: United Archives 25/03/99. United were 4 points ahead of Leeds in the race for the title with 9 games left to play, while Bradford were fighting for survival.

programme.title: PL: Tottenham v United 01/02
programme.desc: United Archives 29/9/01. Up there with one of the greatest comebacks in United's history.

programme.title: PL: United v Tottenham 01/02
programme.desc: United Archives 6/3/02. David Beckham once again produces a fine display against Spurs as the Reds ease to victory at Old Trafford.

programme.title: PL: Leeds v United 01/02
programme.desc: United Archives 30/3/02. Ole Gunnar Solskjaer inspired United to a vital win over Premiership rivals Leeds in a seven-goal thriller at Elland Road.

programme.title: PL: West Ham v United 01/02
programme.desc: United Archives 16/3/02. United are victorious in an eight goal thriller for the second time in the season.

programme.title: 1996 FA Cup SF v Chelsea
programme.desc: United Archives 31/3/96. United faced Chelsea at Villa Park for a place in the FA Cup Final.

programme.desc: United Archives 17/8/96. The Champions opened their season at Selhurst Park in a game best remembered for that goal by David Beckham.
